1: Job replied to Eliphaz and the others,\q1
2:
"I have heard things like that before;\q2 all of you, instead of helping me, are only causing me to feel more miserable.
\q1
3:
Will your speeches, which are only wind, never end?\q2 Eliphaz, what bothers you that makes you continue replying like this to me?


\q1
4:
If it were you three and not I who were suffering,\q2 I could, in your place, say the things that you are saying.
\q1 I could make great speeches to criticize you,
\q2 and I could shake my head at you to ridicule you.
\q1
5:
Then you would see whether my words encouraged you or not;\q2 you would see whether they made you feel your pain less.


\q1
6:
But now, if I talk, my pain does not decrease,\q2 and if I am silent, my pain still certainly does not go away.
\q1
7:
God, you have now taken away all my strength;\q2 you have destroyed all my family.
\q1
8:
You have shriveled me up,\q2 and people think that shows me to be a sinner.
\q1 They see that I am only skin and bones,
\q2 and they think that proves that I am guilty.


\q1
9:
Because God is very angry with me and hates me,\q2 it is as though he were a wild animal that tore me apart with his teeth
\q2 because he was my enemy.
\q1
10:
People gape at me with their mouths open to sneer at me;\q2 they have struck me on the face to ridicule me,
\q2 and they crowd around me to threaten me.


\q1
11:
It is as though God has handed me over to people who refuse to honor him\q2 and has put me into the power of the wicked.
\q1
13:
It is as though I were a target, and that people were surrounding me and shooting arrows at me.\q1 God's arrows pierce my kidneys
\q2 and cause the bile from my liver to spill onto the ground;
\q2 God does not pity me at all.
\q1
14:
It is as though I were a wall that he is breaking through time after time;\q2 he rushes at me like a soldier who is attacking his enemy.


\q1
15:
Because I am mourning, I wear pieces of rough cloth that I have sewed together,\q2 and I sit here in the dirt, very depressed.
\q1
16:
My face is red because I have cried very much,\q2 and there are dark circles around my eyes.
\q1
17:
All this has happened to me even though I have not acted violently toward anyone,\q2 and even though I always pray sincerely to God.


\q1
18:
When I die, I want the ground to act as though I had been murdered;I want it to cry out against those who killed me,
\q2 and I do not want anyone to stop me while I am demanding that God act justly toward me.
\q1
19:
But even now, I know that there is someone in heaven who will testify for me,\q2 and he will say that what I have done is right.


\q1
20:
My three friends scorn me,\q2 but my eyes are full of tears while I cry out to God.
\q1
21:
I pray that the one who knows what I have done would come to plead with God for me\q2 as a person pleads for his friend.
\q1
22: I say this because within a few years I will die;\q2 I will walk along the road to a place from which I will never return."
